com.intersys.objects
Class CandidateKey

java.lang.Object
  com.intersys.objects.CandidateKey
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public class CandidateKey
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable

Data structure that can be used to find an object in database using a predefined key, primary or candidate.

Usually key can be defined by defining a unique index. If the index is designated as primary key, the corrsponidng key is primary.

See Also:
CandidateKeyInfo, Serialized Form

Method Detail

getMetadata

public CandidateKeyInfo getMetadata()

set

public void set(java.lang.String keys)
         throws CacheException
Sets the value according to the argument specified. If key refers to a single column then the value is just a string value for this column. If primary key refers to several columns then a list of comma separated values is expected as keys argument.

Parameters:
keys - Comma separated list of values for key columns.
Throws:
CacheException

set

public void set(int i,
                java.lang.String key)
Sets the value for column i in key structure. Note, that i is the number of the column in the key definition, not in the table.

Parameters:
i - Column number in key definition.
key - Value for a column represneted as String
See Also:
CandidateKeyInfo

set

public void set(java.lang.String columnName,
                java.lang.String key)
         throws CacheException
Sets the value for column columnName in key structure.

Parameters:
columnName - Name fo the column to be set.
key - Value for a column represneted as String
Throws:
CacheException - if there column with name columnName is not used in key definition.
See Also:
CandidateKeyInfo

getOpenMethodName

public java.lang.String getOpenMethodName()
Returns the name of the method that opens the object using this key. Method can be used in COS or in Java Binding and is generated in correponding projection class.

Returns:
The name of method for opening object by this key.

getLength

public int getLength()
Returns the number of columns in key definition. If the key is defined as unique index, it will be the number of column in index definition.

Returns:
The number of columns in key definition.

getSQLName

public java.lang.String getSQLName()
SQL Name of this key used in table definition. It is the same as unique index name if key is defined as unique index.

Returns:
SQL Name of this key used in table definition.

toStringValue

public java.lang.String toStringValue()
This method creates a String representation of the key that can subsequently be used as an argument to set method.

It is simple comma separated list of column values for the key.

Note, that toString() method creates a verbose string that includes key name and column names.

Returns:
String representation of the key that can subsequently be used as an argument to set method.
See Also:
set(String)
